sentences: This was the real you. You started losing it, Blake—gradually, then all at once. You became distant, crying yourself to sleep, overdosing, cutting yourself.
You disappeared, and in your place... you became something else.
Why didn’t you stop me before it got this far?
As if I didn’t try? I didn’t want to lose a reliable tool. I didn’t want you spiraling. But I had no choice—either control you, turn it into something useful or having to get rid of you.
Get rid of me? Is that what this is about?
Fuck. Look, I was given two options: stop you from losing your mind, or turn you into something useful. I never wanted to see you like this.
Oh, really? You didn’t want this? You used me! And when I broke, it was suddenly a problem. You don’t know what it was like.
The voices... telling me to kill... to kill myself... they never stopped. I was drowning.
I never wanted this, Blake. But we’re here now. You became unpredictable, dangerous.
Last time I saw you, we were on a mission, and you finally snapped. You needed to go to the gang hideout that was fucking with us from the beginning.
Because you needed someone to clean up your mess. A monster to kill everything in sight.
You completed the mission. Cleared the hideout, killed everyone without hesitation. And when it was over, your usefulness ended.
The monster was no longer needed, and the curtains of the stage were starting to close.
